Classes and Functions Documentation¶

config_replicator.clear()¶

Function to Clear the terminal window, it should work on linux and windows

config_replicator.help_arg()¶

Function to print help

config_replicator.welcome()¶

Function to print the Welcome Screen

class libs.connection.Connection(q_dest, q_error, q_out, q_succ, user, pwd, en_pwd, cmd, out, dbg, logger, handler)¶

Class for Multithreading to connect to the devices

Arguments:

q_dest = Destination Queue

q_error = Error Queue

q_out = Output Queue

q_succ = Successful Connection Queue

user = username to login to the devices

pwd = password to login to the devices

en_pwd = enable password

cmd = List with the commands to send to the devices

out = Boolean to express that the scripts need an output report

dbg = Boolean to know if Debug is on

logger = Logging object

handler = handler to output debug to file

run()¶

Connection Function

class libs.output_report.OutputReport(q_dest, q_out, script, lst)¶

Class for Multithreading to generate the Output Report for scripts with the directive !output

Arguments:

q_dest = Destination Queue

q_out = Output Queue

script = Response of the Script Menu

lst = Response of the list Menu

run()¶

Output report function

libs.summary_report.summary_report(init_time, fin_time, user, script, lst, thr, tot_dev, q_err, q_succ)¶

Function to save the summary Report

Arguments:

init_time = Time when the script begun

fin_time = Ending time of the script

user = username used to connect to the devices

script = Response of the Script Menu

lst = Response of the list Menu

thr = Number of threads spawned

tot_dev = Total Number of devices processed

q_err = Error queue

q_succ = Successful Connection Queue

class libs.progress.Progress(q_dest, tot_dev, logger)¶

Class for Multithreading to print the progress of the connections

Arguments:

q_dest = Destination Queue

tot_dev = Total Number of devices processed

logger = Logging object

run()¶

Progress printing function

This Module it is used to create well formatted and flexible text menus.

class libs.menu.Menu¶

Class Menu it is the only class and it is used to create the simple text menus, it is modifiable through some arguments and could also handle the loop for the selection returning a tuple with the selected item

Methods

change_cols: Used to change the reserved columns for each field on the menu

add_item: Used to add items to the menu

print_page: Used to print an specific page of the menu

__clear: Used to clear the terminal window, it depends on OS to issue clear or cls it should be work on windows and linux

__previous_page: Used to navigate to a previous menu page

__next_page: Used to navigate to the nex menu page

loop: used to get the user input through a loop

add_item(item, desc)¶

Method used to add items to the Menu

Parameters

item: Item name

desc: Description of the item

change_cols(num, item, desc)¶

This method is used to change the reserved columns for watch field in the menu

Parameters

num: Columns used for the number field in the menu

item: Columns used for the item field in the menu

desc: Columns used for the description field in the menu

loop()¶

Method to enter in a loop for the user input

Returns

Returns a tuple with the format (item_number, item_name, item_description) of the selected option

print_page(page)¶

It prints in a pre-established format the page of the menu

Arguments

page: Page number to print

Navigation Keys

n: next page p: previous page q: quit

Notes

The format establishes the print of the Title first, the subtitle second it it exists, the items to fill one page and regulated by the len_page parameter, at the end prints the instructions to navigate also with the indication on which page you are, there are lines that delimits the diferent fields, if a menu has more pages the top and bottom boundaries could change from “solid” lines to “arrows” to indicate that there are more items on previous or following pages.

class libs.monitoring_gui.monitoringDlg(script, list, th_number, com_list, dest_list, user, pwd, en_pwd, out, parent=None)¶

Class to create the Monitoring window

Arguments:

script = Name of the script used list = Name of the destination list used th_number = Number of threads used com_list = Command List created from the script dest_list = Destination list created from the file user = username to login into the devices pwd = password used to login into the devices en_pwd = Enable Password out = Boolean to know if there is output

closeEvent(evnt)¶

Function to avoid to close the monitor window while running

Function to send the signal with the name of the output report
